p: The food system is a significant source of GHG emissions and contributes 19â€“29% of global emissions. Most of these arise within agriculture [ 18]. As mitigation against climate change reducing emissions from the food system may be needed. Within agriculture, this will require strategies such as improved nutrient management, manure management and enhanced livestock genetics [ 19]. These changes contribute to increasing complexity. It is important that these initiatives do not adversely affect food safety.
